page.title: 04Customs in Chorley (3)
page.content:
The Annual Carnival
Every year for a week early in July, the carnival begins to assemble in and around Astley Park.The carnival is spread over the Friday,Saturday and Sunday and begins with a Fair on the Friday. Saturday is the main day with a lot of 'floats' assembling on Botany Brow.From there they make their way, in procession, to Astley Park where the 'floats' are judged and prizes awarded for the first, second and third places. At the Park there are numerous forms of entertainment which the thousands of people engage in. On Sunday morning a battle is usually enacted in the Park and on Sunday evening the Carnival concludes with a Fair.
